channel.title: Asemica - An asemic Markov-chained cipher
channel.description:
This is a cool tool i found,thought i would share it with everyone-It's called Asemica.
[Github Link](https://github.com/linenoise/asemica)
[Click me for more information](https://n-o-d-e.net/clearnet.html)
Definition: Asemica is a symmetric cipher whose key is a document and whose ciphertext looks like plaintext.
**Why use this?** One of the downsides of encrypting messages and emails is that few people are doing it,you will stick out like a sore thumb to anyone who is monitoring the data. For example, it'd be pretty easy to filter out all messages that contain PGP headers.
So,we use a cipher text which looks like plaintext,This plain text can be combined with PGP for added security.
